Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Indocyanine Green and Technetium Nanocolloid for Sentinel Lymph Node Detection in Pediatric Cancer

Participants.evidence: Conducted at UMC Utrecht, 15 pediatric patients were prospectively included based on eligibility criteria.

Intervention.evidence: Patients received preoperative ICG–TC injections, followed by lymphoscintigraphy and SPECT-CT imaging.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the feasibility of adding indocyanine green (ICG) to 99m technetium nanocolloid (ICG–TC) for sentinel lymph node (SLN) detection in pediatric patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the detection rate of SLNs, measured intraoperatively.

Number_Analysed.evidence: SLNs were transcutaneously visible in 10/15 (67%) patients.

Result_Outcome.evidence: SLNs were transcutaneously visible in 10/15 (67%) patients. Intraoperatively, 35/37 (95%) SLNs were fluorescent, and 37/37 (100%) were radioactive.
